issue.description: The select activity_item should contain: Effectivity

comment.description: Moved to RBN-30-RNTRILS Ap239_work_definition_arm

issue.description: Changed definition of assured set of product and support information
Changed definition of deployment environment
Changed definition of product in focus
Changed definition of product life cycle
Changed definition of support driver

1. Change third paragraph of Introduction to read: This part of ISO 10303 enables the creation and management through time of a set of Assured Product and Support Information (APSI) which can be used to specify and control required support activities throughout a product's life. This information is assumed to be subject to configuration change management to sustain the validity of the information as changes occur through life.

Change fifth paragraph of introduction to read:
This part of ISO 10303 was developed to represent the data associated with complex engineering assets, such as aircraft, ships or weapon systems, which may exist either as a product design, or as an actual product. It can also be applied to much simpler products such a pump or an amplifier. The main industry focus for this part of ISO 10303 is shown by the shaded area of Figure 2 and is characterized by complex products with long life cycles and demanding in-service support requirements.
3. Note under Figure 2 (about fig 3): add the word "been" after "the remainder have".

4. Change paragraph under figure 3 to read:
This part of ISO 10303 combines the functionality of the following parts of ISO 10303 into a single root:
5. Change the text and diagram describing 10303_1292 to reflect changes made to that part. (delete feedback from figure an correct definition of product operational information)
6. The second reference to Activity_as_realized (ISO 10303-1269) should read 1259.

7. Remove second (duplicate) bullet fro description of ap239_work_definition (i.e. delete: the control of work through requests and work orders;) 8. Add word "have" after "schemes may" in next para on ap239_work_definition
9. Scope: second main bullet, 7th sub bullet - correct spelling of "artefact".

Correct the definition of APSI at 3.7.1 to read: "Assured Product Support Information (APSI): the set of information, subject to configuration change management, that is established to develop and deliver support for a product in focus
Section 3.8 Abbreviations: delete "set of" from APSI
the words "for example" is in one of the scope statements, which means it should be tagged as an example.

Change the note at the scope statement so that it is not modules specific - as this prevents reuse by the AP document. E.g.
Further detail on the scope of this part may be obtained from the scope statements of the application modules it uses.

description.p: The following selects are empty:
These means that the following assignments are not used:
Activity_method_assignment_arm (1249) is required by 439, but seems not to be included in the current ballot package or in any earlier one. Same for the MIM Express.
Make Activity_method_assignment_arm available.

comment.description: Activity_method_assignment_arm (1249) has been balloted as part of plcs_bp2 in Ballot package: Condition

description.p:
The definition of AP239_MRI_CLASSIFICATION_ITEM is required by 439, but does not seem to be included in the current ballot package or in any earlier one. (same for Ap239_mri_classified_attribute_select, Characterized_activity_definition, State_of_item, Condition, Information_usage_right_item, Requirement_assignment_item, Requirement_source_item, State_definition_of_item)
This makes it impossible to generate the 439 longform.
Make the definition of AP239_MRI_CLASSIFICATION_ITEM available.

comment.description: I do not understand the comment - the selects are available.

description.p: Consider the error messages and correct the 439 longform where applicable.

comment.description: The long form will be regenerated.

description.p: Observation.applies_to does currently not allow direct pointers to other objects. The referenced entity data type Observation_item identifies the subject for an observation by a string-type identifier. This does not fit to the object-oriented paradigm of STEP product data models, thus, opening up for errors and making the validation of populations difficult.

Replace the string-type attribute Observation_item.item_identifier by an extensible select similar to the _assignment.items selects, but including the option for a string-type identifier for items that do not have instance ids.

comment.description: The scope of the select the required is EVERY SINGLE ENTITY. This is not supportable, either in terms of mapping, or maintenance, or extensibility. Observation explicitly says it is for non-planned/unforeseen comments. Therefore, any limited select will be an invalid use of observation. It is also there to meet the (many) requirements for the need for a free form text field wherever it is needed. Two alternative approaches are to add a text string "comment" to every entity, or to add it as a characterization of every entity (offer them the job). Of course the "correct" approach is to bring aspect oriented approaches to EXPRESS, but that is currently beyond the state of the art. For now reject it, saying that this meets the need to break the paradigm in a controlled way.

description.p: The concept of RBM(Risk Based Maintenance) is becoming more important to apply AP239 to the maintenance of various facilities like industrial plants. The current capabilities of 10303-439 about risk is addressed to the risk of failure mode because it does not include the Risk Module which is based on Risk Resource.
It is recommended to enhance 10303-439 to include Risk Module to deal with various types of risk including environmental issues.

comment.description: Once the Risk module and the Risk common resource is developed and available, it will be included in AP239.

description.p: Document_assignment.is_assigned_to
It should be possible to assign the same document to several product data items. Change the is_assigned_to-attribute to be an aggregate, not, as currently, a single valued attribute.

comment.description: The comment is against "ISO/TS 10303-1122:2003 Document assignment" which is not the subject of this ballot. This has been raised as a SEDS against that module.

description.p: Documented_element_select

It should be possible to assign a document to a String_representation_item. The document may serve as the source/description of a string value. Add String_representation_item to Documented_Element_Select

comment.description: It is intended to use Reference Data libraries (RDL) to store such definitions within AP239. So use external class to classify the string representation with the source/description of a string value being held in the RDL

description.p: Documented_element_select

It should be possible to assign a Document to a Class. E.g., a class that represents a type of symbol may benefit from descriptions that are given in a document. Add Class to Documented_Element_Select

comment.description: It is intended to use Reference Data libraries (RDL) to store such definitions/descriptions within AP239. The representation and exchange of reference data is not within the scope of AP239.

description.p: Property_assignment_select

It should be possible to assign properties to a Product_version_relationship! Example: A removal route may be considered as a property of a Product_as_realized in the context of its installation in a greater context (another Product_as_realized). A Product_version_relationship connects the two individual products, provides the context, and should, thus, be assigned the property. Add Product_version_relationship to Property_Assignment_Select.

comment.description: The use of Product_version_relationship is inappropriate in this situation. You should use View_definition_relationship or View_definition_usage instead. These can have properties assigned.

description.p: Task

Task inherits a mandatory attribute purpose. In addition it has a (potentially empty) set of objectives. purpose: the text that provides an informal description of the reason for the Activity_method . objective: the intended result or results of the task. Reason and intended result are semantically close to each other. Users may, therefore, consider a set of objectives to be sufficient documentation of the reason for a task. Make the Task.purpose attribute optional.

comment.description: In EXPRESS it is not possible to change an inherited attribute from mandatory to optional.

issue.description: Introduction Figure 3 - Abstraction of module hierarchy Change the name by the name of the module without underscore For example changing Ap236_product_life_cycle_support by AP236 product life cycle support.

comment.description: Have changed all references to module names so that there are no underscores and the implementation level modules have a name AP239 instead of Ap239

issue.description: Introduction Paragraph after Figure 4 Level 2 modules developed for specific APs may be named 'AP2xx_<generic name of module>'. AP239_work_definition

comment.description: Have changed all references to module names so that there are no underscores and the implementation level modules have a name AP239 instead of Ap239

issue.description: AP239_product_life_cycle_support_mim_lf should be lower case in .exp and .xml files. NOTE this name in href fragements in mim_lf.htm causes html link errors.

comment.description: The link have been changed to be lower case.

description.p: (2) Clause: 10303-439 clause 5.2

No global rules are defined to constrain the MIM population according to the ARM. In the long form in total 17 rules are found. We expect at least a few hundred to ensure all ARM constraints. Without these rules it will not be possible to verify if a MIM population fir to the ARM constraints.

Generate all needed global rules automatically by a suitable program to ensure that every constraint on the ARM side is ensured of the MIM side. This includes relations between objects, sub-supertpye constraints, compliance with reference path in mapping table.

comment.description:
The rules are actually explicit in the mapping table. As agreed at the Seattle SC4 meeting, explicit rules could be extracted and made available once the automated software is developed.
A major objective for AP239 is to support the consolidation of relevant information over time. Experience has shown that many rules introduced to ensure consistency for data exchange are naturally invalidated when considering the aggregation of data over time. This has led to using an approach where rules have been kept to a minimum and are deliberately left for inclusion in data exchange sets, where a specific business context applies. The data exchange sets will also provide guidance on the use of subtypes of product and other entities that have subtypes declared in distinct modules.

description.p: (3) Paragraph: 5.2
Not one Global Rule is defined for the AP. An AP of this complexity needs probably more than 100 global rules to avoid and detect invalid data
Add all global rules in the AIM needed to a) ensure the ARM constraints and b) eliminating invalid ANDOR combinations and c) ensuring correct subtyping of entities.

comment.description: See: ap239_product_life_cycle_support#DE-2

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Event_assignment.items

Currently Events may only be assigned to two concepts: Certification and Project. May not "all" kinds of product data be subject to an Event? Guidance seems to exist to use Activity instead of Event. This is not obvious from the documentation of the standard.
Update the documentation to make the distinctions in the use of Event and Activity clear.

comment.description: Event is only present for backwards compatibility with the PDM Schema. The PLCS approach is use to Activity instead. In order to clarify this approach a Usage guidance section will be added to the AP document.
Add commentary to annex H of AP document.
Added commentary to annex H of AP document.

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Product_category_assignment.products
It should also be possible to assign Product_category to Tasks and Organizations (and maybe others). This would ensure a consistent way of handling categorization in STEP.
Update model or documentation (especially Product_category).

comment.description: Classification is the preferred approach to classifying things. The Product_categorization approach has been preserved for historical / backward compatibility reasons. See product_categorization/dvlp/issues.xml#DE-7
Discussed in BCR workshop. Norway accepts position - add text to Annex H to describe difference in usage between product_category and classification.
Text added to Annex H to describe difference in usage between product_category and classification.

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Classification_item

It should be possible to classify entity data types Activity_property_representation and Resource_property_representation (as it is possible to classify Property_representation). The role-attribute is the reason for why classification makes sense.
Include Activity_property_representation and Resource_property_representation in Classification_item.
Discussed in BCR workshop. Add to Classified_item and Attribute_classification.

comment.description: Updated Ap239_activity-recording and AP239_task_specification_recording accordingly.

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Activity_item

It should be possible to assign an Activity to an Assigned_property. This is to say more about the method how a value was calculated than what Qualified_property_value_representation.value_determination can express.
Include Assigned_property in Activity_item.
Discussed in BCR workshop. Add to Activity_item select.

Noted that the extension of selects to property related entities is inconsistent. Select matrix copy updated with several entries that need to be included to ensure a consistent approach to the meta data around properties.
Already resolved in Ap239_work_definition, although will requre appropriate reference data to indicate the reversing of the sense of the assignment.
(2) Clause: ISO/CD-TS 10303-1184:- Document as individual
(3) Paragraph: 4.2.1 Document_as_individual
Is there a requirement to model individual documents in PLCS? Do they have serial numbers? E.g. The microfiche with serial number 98/1234 is an Document_as_individual
Add Document_as_individual to the PLCS longform? Clarify any impacts for document property assignments

comment.description: The module "Document_as_individual" has not been published. The individual document can be managed as a product-as_individual.

description.p: (2) Clause: Express
There are no rules enforcing any of the mandatory attributes on most of the key entities of the model.
Discuss if adding rules on Product for example, would make the model more strict & less prone to abuse (bad data).

comment.description: See: ap239_product_life_cycle_support#DE-2

description.p: (2) Clause: Express

The model has been developed in a modular fashion, and many of those have been done in isolation. This results in several modelling styles, which hinders consistency. The natural result of this is that it is then hard to apply global rules since many parts do not inherit the same semantics.

A hierarchy separating out design, planned individuals and realized individuals on one hand and the entities used across the domain (part, slot etc..), on the other - would allow complex types to be built. This make it easier for global rules to enforce consistency and a reduction in the size of the model, paperwork, guidance material etc..

comment.description: The modules have been structured to provide backward compatibility with existing STEP. Whilst the re modelling of STEP may be attractive, it is not feasible at this stage given the business requirement to maintain backward compatibility. Rejected after discussion with person who raised comment.

description.p: (2) Clause: ISO/TS 10303-1123:2004 Document definition
document_location_select from module appears to be mising from the plcs schema.

comment.description: The select: document_location_select is not actually used anywhere so the SHTOLO algorithm prunes it as it serves no purpose in the model.

description.p: (2) Clause: ARM Express
(3) Paragraph: Name_assignment.items, Assigned_name_select
The select-type Assigned_name_select contains only one select item: External_class_library. It seems desirable that the select-type is as rich as comparable ones, e.g., Identification_item.
Update the model or the documentation.

comment.description: Name assignment was only introduced for harmonization/mapping purposes. If you want to assign a name to something, use identification_assignment.

Add comment to explain this (slight) anomaly in Annex I. This should also describe the usage of id_assignment. Also discussion over need to have management data associated with External_class_library. Could be changed in ap239_management_resource_information. Will note this.

issue.description: The first words in the in-scope/out-of-scope lists should be lowercase (except for complete senteces).

comment.description: Changed all bullets to lower case.

issue.description:
When trying to instantiate data in there I found that the select type action_items is defined cyclic (the compiler should have discovered that :-/ ). One of its select items is statechar_action_items which is defined to be:
TYPE statechar_action_items = action_items; WHERE ...
9.1 in P11 says: Type declarations shall not result in cyclic type definitions.
Could you remove statechar_action_items from action_items?

comment.description: Removed as requested.

issue.description: Every state observed must be an observation of some state definition. There are differences in the two lists taken from the long form, in particular, the observed includes Message and Task_method_version for which there are no definitions, and definitions include Product_category and Applied_activity_method_assignment for which there is no observed.

comment.description: Both lists extended to ensure equivalance.

issue.description:
The AIM longform (439 MIM) does not include the entity application_protocol_definition. There has probably been a discussion about this earlier, I am not sure.
My concern now is that this entity is a part of the PDM schema. For upward compatibility it needs to be included in 239/439. The Product_data_management_mim of 203e2 does also include it.
439 should include the entity and 239 should constrain the population of its attributes.

comment.description:
this topic was discussed in some meeting in Seattle and that we had a common understanding that every AP, even the modular ones should have a rule like the one below from AP214.
-------------- 5.2.4.1 application_protocol_definition_required The application_protocol_definition_required rule ensures that at least one application_protocol_definition is specified that provides the designator 'automotive_design' of this application protocol.
*) RULE application_protocol_definition_required FOR (application_context); WHERE WR1: SIZEOF( QUERY( ac <* application_context | (SIZEOF (QUERY (apd <* USEDIN(ac,'AUTOMOTIVE_DESIGN.APPLICATION_PROTOCOL_DEFINITION.APPLICATION') | apd.application_interpreted_model_schema_name = 'automotive_design' )) > 0) )) > 0;
END_RULE; (*
Argument definitions:
application_context: the set of all instances of application_context.
Formal propositions
WR1: At least one instance of application_context shall be refered by one instance of application_protocol_definition which contains the instance of application_context as its application attribute and has a application_interpreted_model_schema_name of 'automotive_design'.
Added rule.
Updated the arm_lf manually

issue.description: The rule RULE application_protocol_definition_required FOR is incorrect there is a double '' USEDIN(ac,''AP239_PRODUCT_LIFE_CYCLE_SUPPORT_MIM_LF.APPLICATION_PROTOCOL_DEFINITION.APPLICATION') shoudl USEDIN(ac,'AP239_PRODUCT_LIFE_CYCLE_SUPPORT_MIM_LF.APPLICATION_PROTOCOL_DEFINITION.APPLICATION')

comment.description: Fixed
